form.current-chamber: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

action.action-desc: Mr. Cruz (for himself, Mrs. Blackburn, Mrs. Britt, Mr. Scott of Florida, and Mr. Tuberville) introduced the following bill; which was read twice and referred to the Committee on Armed Services

form.official-title: To amend the mission statement of the United States Military Academy to include the phrase “Duty, Honor, Country”.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Maintaining Academy Culture and Assuring Retention of Tradition, Honor, and Unity of the Republic Act (MACARTHUR) Act.
It is the sense of Congress that the principles of Duty, Honor, Country should be—

paragraph.text: deeply embedded in the ethos of the United States Military Academy; and

section.header: Modification of united states military academy mission statement

subsection.text: Not later than 30 days after the date of the enactment of this Act, the Secretary of the Army shall amend the mission statement of the United States Military Academy to include the phrase Duty, Honor, Country.
